title: macOS Clamav
body:
I donâ€™t want to resident Clamav, but I would like to keep it safe because it is a full scan regularly.

## Environment

Macbook Air

## Install

Install using homebrew.

```bash
$ brew install clamav
```

## Vulnerability/Virus Pattern Update

## Prepare configuration files

By default, use the provided.

```bash
$ cp /opt/homebrew/etc/clamav/freshclam.conf.sample /opt/homebrew/etc/clamav/freshclam.conf
```

Exampleminate Example lines from `/opt/homebrew/etc/clamav/freshclam.conf`.


## Update vulnerability/virus pattern


```bash
$ freshclam
```

## Run Scan

Scan the home directory.

```bash
$ calmscan ~/ --recursive --infected
```

`- recursive`: recursively verify the contents of the file.
`- in ed`: limits the output contents only to the virus file.

## Regular execution

```bash
$ crontab -e
```

Pattern update / Home directory scan execution at 0 on Sunday

```bash
0 0 * * 0 freshclam && clamscan /Users/kemu/ --recursive --infected
```
